Our services

Delivering great services that exceed people's expectations

What do we do?

The communities in which we offer services, are the same communities in which our staff live and belong to. This connection to community gives us depth of understanding and connection to each other. We recognise our experience as members of the communities and as a quality service provider offering services for many people who may face barriers now or in the future.

Foster Care

Disability

Aged Care

We also offer support to
  • Child, youth and families
  • Mental health
  • Refugees and asylum seekers
  • Housing and homelessness
  • Alcohol and other drugs
  • Domestic violence

Our promise to you

We know you are the experts in your own life. We will listen and be guided by you so you are empowered to make choices, you want to make to improve your wellbeing and increase your opportunity to participate in the community. To achieve this, we will:

  • Take the time to truly know you and your support network
  • Always act with integrity
  • Honour our commitments
  • Live our values in our relationship with you

What is different about us?

Its our purpose and values. Our values are in the hearts and minds of our people. It's the heartbeat of our culture.

Read about Our Values

Want to know more?

If you would like to know more or have any questions about any of our services, then please feel free to contact us on:

  • 1800 000 000
  • info@lwb.org.au

Learn more about social policy at Life Without Barriers

    RECONCILIATION STATEMENT

    In the spirit of Reconciliation, UNITYCARE acknowledges Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples as the Traditional Owners and Custodians of this country, and acknowledges their connection to land, water and community. We pay our respect to them, their cultures and customs, and to Elders past, present and emerging.

    Learn more about our steps towards reconciliation
